lexUnit.name: arch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To from or cause a curved structure.

sentence.text: Arch your back as high as you can and drop your head .
She snatched Buster from his play and we went back into the house where she held him close to her face , laughing as the big cat purred and arched himself ecstatically against her cheek .
She digs claws deep into their shoulders , arches her spine against them .
She arched a brow at him , feeling a shudder of pure sensation when she saw the open admiration in his dark eyes .
Arching his fingertips together in a gesture his subordinates , for sufficient reason , knew boded no good , he leaned back in his chair and enquired , ` What else has emerged ? "
Standing on tiptoe , she arched her lower body to his scarcely needing the encouragement of his hand pressing against her spine .
The god of Creation in Aboriginal legend ; known as Yulunggu , he appears as a rainbow snake who arches himself across the sky early in the rainy season .
They persuaded him on to a bed , though he arched his body away from the contact of the sheet .
Try not to arch the back during this exercise .
He arched one foot like a cat 's back , and said , ` Aahh . "
She shrugged , stretched her arms out , arching her back .
She arched her back , tried to stretch her neck above assorted flesh and hair and smell .
She arched her eyebrows .
The crib-biter grips a fixed object with its teeth , arches its neck , and swallows air .
But the mare was arching her back and groaning in such agony now that Luke only just managed to keep her on her feet .
He arched his neck upwards and pressed his lips against hers .
He arched wicked black brows .
She turned her head round , he saw her shoulders tense and her back arch again .
Graham 's back arched agonizingly and he used every last ounce of inner strength to keep himself from wrenching his hand off the pad .
His brow arched delicately .
One of his eyebrows arched ironically .
Her eyebrows arched suddenly .
It had a sharp , pointed face and a feathery tail that arched over its back .
